title: PSA: Stop "counterpicking" champions you can't play
body:
Seriously, if you cannot fucking play the champion you are picking to counter someone, if they are halfway decent you are still going to get smashed. 

Pick who you are good with.

I kind of feel the same way about {{champion:57}} vs {{champion:31}} , I have been put against so many Cho'gaths as Mao and find the matchup to just slowly go into cho's favor. He outsustains you due to his passive, his W will prevent you from pulling anything off on him, he brings much more damage to the table than you due to his execute, and he gets way tankier due to his stacks. The only thing that mao has on him is way better peels and teamfight.

Honestly a Mao / Cho lane falls into Mao's favor; if both rush Rod of Ages, and then Mao rushes Spirit Visage, he shoudn't care about cho's damage anymore. 

Mao also has %health on his W, where Cho doesn't. Neither should really kill the other, but Mao shoudn't be afraid of Cho'Gath unless the jungler shows up.

I'm gonna say "Depends how strong the counter is". The first time I had ever played against Irelia, I looked her up and brought Nasus. I'm not really good at him or tanks in general, I'm definitely an ADC main, but I countered her so hard she just couldn't do anything. She Qs for a minion, she gets smacked upside the head. She comes in on me, she gets withered and smacked upside the head. She was 10,000 times more useful once early game was over, but I can't stop my bot lane from feeding an underfed Irelia.

Okay, well substitute what you would consider a hard counter, you get my point though.

Quinn VS Riven. Unless Quinn plays stupidly Riven just gets destroyed cos she can't get to Quinn without using mutliple q's/e/flash, and after that she gets blinded while Quinn uses w passive to walk away.
You mean her E? And her passive isn't walkspeed..{{champion:133}} {{item:3009}}

No, I'm assuming that Quinn already used her E to cancel part of Riven's Q/E which she would be using to close the gap onto Quinn, and then Riven continued to go hard with the rest of her Q. 

Quinn's W has an active component which gives vision, but also a passive component. The passive part gives Quinn bonus movespeed and attack speed after procing a harrier, and that's what I'm talking about - even after using her E to force Riven to use ALL her abilities to get on top of Quinn, Quinn can still blind Riven preventing a very major part of her damage - Riven's passive - from working, and after that her W's passive component gives her enough movespeed that she can just walk away when the blind wears off.
